alert.note: Alert for Pottawatomie (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 05 at 10:09AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Oklahoma, eastern Cleveland, west central Pottawatomie and southwestern McClain Counties through 1045 AM CDT... At 1009 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Washington, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Norman, Purcell, Choctaw, Noble, Slaughterville, Lexington, Pink, Goldsby, Washington, Cole, Stella, Newalla, Lake Thunderbird, Bethel Acres and Little Axe. This includes the following highways... Interstate 35 between mile markers 91 and 105. Interstate 40 between mile markers 164 and 174. Interstate 240 near mile marker 16. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
